Indeed.
 
 I can't imagine what it must have been like to innocently sit in jail for 22 years.
 
 The question is: how do you measure the destruction of a mans life in terms of money?
 
 If I were him the only compensation I'd want is to have the DA sit in jail for 22 years. ;)

Well, I do know what it is like to be wrongfully convicted. But don't fault the DA. If you recall, the technology concerning DNA evidence did not exist 22 years ago. Also, Current Erie County DA Frank Clark correctly asserted that eyewitness testimony is highly unreliable. But I agree that you cannot put a price on this. (BTW, like my new user title? An homage to the late, great Victor Borge ;) )
How do you compensate those whom George Walker Bush wrongfully executed when he was governor of Texas?

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  It's About Time!
